name: Know Your Food
description:
What’s in your food?

From food labels to nutrition myths to healthy diets, this quiz puts your food and nutrition knowledge to the test. It is designed to spark conversation around how marketing, cultural beliefs, and experiences that shape our nutrition knowledge. Come on your own or with friends, you’ll be grouped for a beginner-friendly food trivia experience.

name: Does the Body Count Calories?
description:
How does the body count calories, and are all calories truly equal?

In an age of calorie counters, fitness watches, and food labels, energy seems easy to measure and neatly quantified. Yet what happens inside the body is far more complex. In this talk, Prof. Ullas Kolthur Seetharam from the Advanced Research Unit on Metabolism, Development, and Aging (ARUMDA) looks beyond weight and BMI to examine how nutrition, metabolism, and body composition shape our health.

Drawing on ARUMDA's research, he unpacks how the body processes food, senses energy needs, and adapts to growth, activity, and aging. He explores why calories are not all equal, how energy expenditure is regulated beyond what labels tell us, and what body composition reveals that body weight alone cannot. Bridging molecular biology, technology, and public health, the talk connects scientific insights to everyday questions around diet, growth, obesity, undernutrition, and metabolic disease. Offering a research-based view of how our bodies manage energy in this ever-changing food landscape.

This workshop explores the themes of ‘EAT’ & ‘DIGEST’ in relation to Science Gallery Bengaluru’s Exhibition CALORIE.

name: What Makes You Up? Understanding Your Body’s Composition
description:
What does the scale really tell us about our bodies?

In this workshop, Prof. Ullas Kolthur decodes our weight, looking at fat, muscle, and body water to better understand how our bodies store and use energy. Using a portable body composition analyser, he explores how nutrition, calories, and metabolism are measured, and where these measurements fall short.

Drawing on both scientific research and lived experiences, the workshop invites participants to look beyond the scale and rethink what these numbers mean for health and nutrition. 

This workshop explores the themes of ‘EAT’ & ‘DIGEST’ in relation to Science Gallery Bengaluru’s Exhibition CALORIE.

name: All Work and No Play : An Exploration of Labour in CALORIE
description:
In the age of steam engines, calorie as a unit was imagined as a measure of labour. Today calorie means food. Let's take a look at the labour that goes into bringing food from farm to table and from table to wastelands. From cultivating to selling, from segregating to treatment, who are these people making food possible?

Join Ayati and Megha as they explore CALORIE through the lens of labour.

name: Math is Fun: The Symmetry All Around Us
description:
How can we use symmetry to understand the world around us?

Join Disha as she explores symmetry using visual examples and everyday patterns from sarees, wallpapers, and floor tiles. Learn how these familiar designs can be described using mathematics. Take a “sneak peek” into group theory—the part of mathematics that studies symmetry and shows how complex patterns can be broken into simpler pieces.

No advanced mathematical background is needed. This workshop is for anyone who enjoys patterns, structure, and discovering how mathematics connects to the world around us.

This workshop is for participants of ages 15 and above.

name: Oota From Your Thota | Day 1
description:
Register for programmes here: https://zapigo.co/Gw4J4

What does it take to grow food in a city?
Oota from your Thota—which translates to Food from your Garden—is a community-led urban gardening movement that has been inspiring Bengalureans to grow their own food for over a decade. From balconies and terraces to backyard plots, the initiative brings together citizens who believe that small green spaces can create healthier, more resilient cities.

Marking its 50th edition, this two-day event at Science Gallery Bengaluru invites you to explore urban foodscapes as a lifestyle movement. Expect conversations, panel discussions, and stories from everyday gardeners who have transformed their homes into living food systems. The event also includes stalls featuring organic gardening supplies, seeds, saplings, eco-friendly products and organic food.

Whether you are curious about starting your first kitchen garden, looking to deepen your practice, or simply interested in how cities can grow differently, Oota from your Thota offers a space to learn, share and imagine greener urban futures—together.

- Oota From Your Thota | Day 1 | Programmes

10:00 AM - 11:15 AM  			
Oota from your Thota - 50 events journey;Urban Gardening for Liveable Cities
Inaugural Event

11:30 AM - 12:30 PM

Panel discussion

12:30 PM - 1:30 PM
Garden Spaces as Significant Contributors to Biodiversity
Talk						

2:30 PM - 3:30 PM
Respecting Life & Efficient use of resources in Urban Foodscapes 
Talk	

2:30 PM - 3:30 PM
Chinnara Kaithota - An Experience Connecting with Nature for Children
Workshop


3:30 PM - 4:30 PM				
Urban Gardening: Employment & Entrepreneurship Opportunities for Youth
Talk	

5:00 PM - 6:00 PM			
Ask an expert - Urban Foodscapes Q&A
Discussion		

5:30 PM
Calorie exhibition walkthrough 
Walkthrough
